document.docAuthor: Irwin, Michael E. & Winterton, Shaun L.
document.docTitle: Argolepida schlingeri Irwin & Winterton 2021, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of South American stiletto fly genus Argolepida Metz & Irwin (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of South American stiletto fly genus Argolepida Metz & Irwin (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Emeritus, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, Illinois, USA, and University of Arizona, Tucson, USA.
California State Collection of Arthropods, California Department of Food & Agriculture, Sacramento, California, USA.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 25 .
Argolepida schlingeri
sp. n.
: male, oblique view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Male frons with small and elongate medial glabrous area, female with ‘shield’-like glabrous area across frons; wing hyaline; abdominal tergites 1–6 with white scale-like adpressed setae; femora mostly brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 26 .
Argolepida schlingeri
sp. n.
: male, lateral view.

FIGURE 27 .
Argolepida schlingeri
sp. n.
: female, oblique view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology . We are honoured to name this species after the Late Dr Evert I. Schlinger, mentor and collector of many specimens belonging to the genus
Argolepida
.

Comments .
Argolepida schlingeri
sp. n.
is extensively covered in adpressed scale-like setae and is similar to
A. patagonia
sp. n.
, differing mostly in having hyaline wings and the shield-like shape of the female frontal glabrous patch. This species is distributed along the Western slopes of the Andes in Northern Argentina ; it overlaps in distribution with
P. rivulosa
and
P. telteca
sp. n.

Holotype
male, ARGENTINA :
Tucumán Province
: Casa del Campo , Hwy 40 at km 992 [ - 26.5473 , -66.0230 ],
5,920 ft.
, white sand area,
18.X.1997
, M.E. Irwin , F.D. Parker , S. Roig (MEI107007; MNBR )
.

: ARGENTINA :
Tucumán Province
: 23 males , 6 females , same data as holotype (MEI106546–52, 106999–7006, 107008, 106991–6, 106998–9, 107014–9; CSCA , CASC , UCCS )
.
